item.description:
Author Lecture: David Fisichella, "Seven-Tenths: Love, Piracy and Science at Sea" @ New England Aquarium

From the New England Aquarium Site:
http://www.eventkeepe...

"Aquarium Lecture Series
"7:00 PM - 9:00 PM
"Seven-Tenths: Love, Piracy and Science at Sea
"David Fisichella, Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution (WHOI)

"Location: Harborside Learning Lab
"Price: Free

"While studying the world’s oceans, a disillusioned man and a blind oceanographer find love and adventure. David Fisichella learned how researchers study ocean physics and why; how people live for months at a time at sea and what it means to be working for, and dating, the Chief Scientist.

"David Fisichella manages shipboard scientific services at Woods Hole Oceanographic Institute. His wife, Amy Bower, Ph.D., is a senior scientist at WHOI".

... This memoir was just published April of 2010. Ah! The age old stories of love, romance, the physics of the ocean, and being attacked by pirates. I gotta hear about this... And the "seven-tenths" part describes how much of the earth is covered by water.

Registration Link: http://support.neaq.o...

Where to Meet:

T.J. Maher will be waiting in front of the entrance to the Harborside Learning Lab starting at 6:20 pm. Let's go in to grab seats at 6:40 pm. Anybody up for Legal Seafoods after? First we hear about fish, then we eat 'em!

T.J. is 5 foot 7 with short brown hair, blue eyes, a "Hello My Name is T.J." nametag, and a red MEETUP sign attached to his black messenger bag.

About the Aquarium Lecture Series:

"The Aquarium has been providing free lectures and films by scientists, environmental writers, photographers and others since 1972. The Aquarium Lecture Series is presented free to the public through the generosity of the Lowell Institute, which has been providing funding for free public lectures at universities and museums since 1836.

"Lectures are free and open to the public. Registration is requested. All programs start at 7 p.m. in the Aquarium's Harborside Learning Lab, unless otherwise noted below. Programs last approximately one hour followed by a reception".

Directions to the Harborside Learning Lab:

Facing the main building of the Aquarium, the IMAX theater on the right, just before the IMAX theater there is a sidestreet with a row of offices on the right. The Harborside Learning Lab is the last entrance on the right. [ See the Map of the Aquarium Front Plaza - Exterior http://www.neaq.org/v... ].

Directions:
http://www.neaq.org/v...

"The closest subway stop is just 100 yards from the Aquarium. It is the Aquarium stop on MBTA’s Blue Line. All other subway lines connect to the Blue Line, and stops off all of the lines are only a short walk from the Aquarium, including the State stop on the Orange Line (8-minute walk), the Government Center stop on the Green Line (10-minute walk), and the South Station stop on the Red Line (10-15-minute walk)".
item.name: Author Lecture: David Fisichella, "Seven-Tenths: Love, Piracy and Science at Sea
